raw_text: One may object that this example is somewhat far-fetched, but Chiang (2000) notes that head-lexicalized stochastic grammars fall short in encoding even simple dependency relations such as between left and John in the sentence John should have left. This is because Magerman ' s head-percolation scheme makes should and have the heads of their respective VPs so that there is no dependency relation between the verb left and its subject John
